file_content.text: Perfect solitude for a year. Now, four interruptions in a day. Frustrating.
I didn't lead the Jedi or Sith here, boss. I don't know how they found you.
Sorry, I've been a real chatterbox lately.
Yeah, that was me.
Are you insane? Why would you lead them here?
You can smell this place from the Dune Sea. Face it, Diago's kind of a slob.
They followed their noses?
Hey! You can't talk like that in front of the boss!
I'm just here for the sensor computer. Be out of your hair in no time.
I need my stuff.
You can't just cut and run. Help us clean up this mess!
Why do I get the feeling you're playing us against each other? Can't believe you'd jeopardize your reward from me.
Reward? What's she talking about?
Leave me out of your little drama, all right?
I'm a neutral party, here.
Cold feet, hmm? Thought you were tougher than that.
No time to explain.
When are you planning to tell me, you double-crossing scum?
You know how Sith are--all fuzzy in the head.
She's confused.
That's not what you said at the spice factory.
Consider Zare a gift, gorgeous. Anything you want, I can deliver.
[Flirt.] I brought her to you.
You have no idea the danger you've put yourself in.
First a Sith, now this. Distraction after distraction, Tookreek. Annoying.
The captain is here on important business. The Sith came uninvited, boss.
The Sith's with me. It's nice having friends on the dark side.
Actually, we're together.
We're the best friends to have.
You're a fool if you believe that.
The years haven't been kind, Diago--or were you always this nauseating?
You're revolting, boss.
I've seen old holos. He used to be quite dashing. Pity.
Look long and hard, Zare. That's how all servants of evil end up.
I just want my sensor computer. Then I'm leaving.
I'm only here for my fee.
So quickly? What about your reward for leading me here?
You won't be giving out any rewards.
If you're wondering, I followed you here. Didn't believe your story for a moment.
I knew you knew I was lying. I wanted you to follow me.
Glad you caught my hint.
You led a Jedi right to the boss? You fool!
It wasn't personal. Zare made the better offer.
Can't blame me for trying.
You stabbed me in the back! The boss will kill you for this.
It's hard to be subtle when you're this good-looking.
[Flirt.] Win some, lose some.
What does that have to do with anything?
I'm gonna let you girls settle this between yourselves.
She's all yours, Zare.
Wouldn't it be more fun to deal with her together?
You had every chance to do the right thing, and failed. Now, you'll suffer the consequences.
Now another joins the Jedi to irritate me like sand flies. Is this how you serve, Tookreek? Inept.
The captain and I have business. We had nothing to do with this Jedi.
I invited the Jedi. She's a little stiff, but basically alright.
She's with me.
You shouldn't have followed me. It isn't safe here.
Oh, you have no idea.
The Lightspring is a real dump. So's Diago, for that matter.
This place stinks.
It pains me to see such ugliness spoiling natural wonder.
You Jedi are so tedious. Sensitive to every little thing.
I'd like to finish my business, if you don't mind.
Where's my sensor computer?
It was foolish to come here. You're gambling with your life.
For once, we agree on something.
Hello again. Forcing me to follow you through that blazing desert? Not your best move.
You seem to have gotten here just fine without my help.
It didn't slow you down.
You could've done so much better for yourself.
You love me, and you know it.
[Flirt.] Don't be cross.
Enjoy playing games? I'll show you some new ones.
What can I say?
That chill creeping down your spine right now? It's regret.
I hope you got blisters all over your pale Sithy feet.
I'm not sorry.
I'm feeling especially unsympathetic toward you.
Surrender is your only option, Zare. You can't win.
What have you dragged to my sanctum, Tookreek? Another petty annoyance? Foolish.
The captain is here on business, boss. We mean no disrespect.
Would've gotten here sooner, but I had to stop and lie to a Jedi.
Sorry I'm late.
Only fools lie to Jedi. I have no business with you.
Perfect. I have you all to myself.
Looks like the infamous Diago Hixan really let himself go.
This blob deserves respect?
Physicality is empty. It's no concern for the king of the underworld.
You'll find my physicality anything but empty.
I'm here for the sensor computer you stole from Nok Drayen. Hand it over.
Give me what I want.
A buzzing sand fly commands the king of the underworld? Who are you?
Nobody worthwhile--but I'm the best thing you'll ever lay eyes on.
Hello again. Despite your absurd refusal to cooperate, you were extremely easy to follow. I suppose I should be grateful.
I know I am. The trail led me to you, Zare.
Is it just me, or is this cavern starting to feel small?
This is ridiculous.
This is all your fault. You embarrassed me in front of the boss.
Wow, what an entrance.
Stand back. This is Jedi business. I don't want you getting hurt.
You ladies obviously have issues to sort out.
Let me get out of your way.
The only one here with issues is little Nariel.
You're both gorgeous and amazing. It's just not fair.
[Flirt.] I can't choose.
A Jedi, a Sith, a lackey and a rogue. What do they add up to?
Empty chatter, like fingernails on transparisteel. I will silence--who is that?
Captain? Haven't heard from you in a while. Everything alright?
I'm kind of in the middle of something, Risha.
This is a bad time.
I've got a Jedi and a Sith fighting over me, but I only have eyes for you.
[Flirt.] I'm better now.
Nothing you say makes any sense.
Poor Nariel. She's never been kissed.
Such a professional, who could resist?
I've got things under control.
Stop worrying.
Seems like it.
I'm not sure yet.
Are you in trouble? Talk to me.
Beautiful girl... so beautiful....
Wait, is that him? You're with Diago?
I want to see her again. Now.
She, uh, doesn't seem to be answering her holo.
I can't.
Then bring her to me. She is mine.
I could set you two up, if you're interested.
You like her?
Bring her to me, and I'll forgive you for disturbing my sanctuary.
I don't work for you.
It wasn't a request. You bring her to me or I take her from you.
Diago, dear, I can offer you so much more--just as soon as we rid ourselves of this Jedi.
Afraid to fight me alone, Sith?
Silence! The only voice here should be mine!
Diago, you're every bit the monster Vaverone Zare is. You will both pay.
You want to kill the Jedi.
You want to drop your weapons.
Stop waving your hands like that. You both look ridiculous.
Oh, knock it off.
If I drop my weapons, how can I help you?
I'll help. [Attack the Sith.]
You owe me big-time, Zare.
Fat chance. [Attack the Jedi.]
You want to draw your weapon. You want to kill the Jedi.
I want to laugh at how silly you are.
Is that supposed to work?
Strong-minded, hmm? You're no use to me.
You want to kill your captain.
I... I want to kill you, Captain.
You... you need to die, Captain.
Forgive me, dear Diago, but I really must kill these two before we continue.
I think I'd rather kill you.
No I don't. [Attack the Sith.]
Sure, fine. [Attack the Jedi.]
You want to lay down your weapons. You want to surrender.
Does your little hand-waving thing ever work?
You're not so good at that.
Why must you be so difficult?
It would have been so much better if you'd surrendered.
You want to run away.
I'm out of here, Captain!
This is not our battle.
Have you totally lost your mind?
What are you doing?
Don't listen to her! It's a trick!
Snap out of it!
You worthless fool.
Stop waving your hand like a fool and let's kill that Sith.
Quiet. [Attack the Sith.]
Nope. [Attack the Jedi.]
Stay out of this and I promise you won't be harmed.
Stay with me and I promise much more.
What's our play, Captain?
Whose side are we on?
I can't have a dead Jedi on my conscience.
We're with the Jedi.
Whew! That's a relief.
Sith will be a better fight anyway.
Plenty of reasons to help them both. What's your preference?
You pick.
I'll trust a Jedi before I ever trust a Sith.
Fought a Jedi before. Never fought a Sith.
We should at least get some reward for all this trouble.
Let's help the Sith.
Good. I was starting to think I'd lost my touch.
Don't give in to greed.
I came here for a sensor computer. I don't need anything else.
All I want is what's mine.
It's over, Zare. Surrender or die.
You think I'd trust a Sith?
I won't. [Attack the Sith.]
You won't live long enough to regret this.
If I stopped giving in to greed, I wouldn't have anything to do.
Sorry. [Attack the Jedi.]
The Force is with me.
No more! I'll find the beautiful girl myself. Droids! Kill everyone!
But I didn't do anything!
Everyone!
